result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Wayne A Barbion Jr was found guilty of OWI (4th) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 30 months bifurcated sentence.

**DEFENDANT ELIGIBLE FOR SAPE AFTER SERVING 12 MONTHS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT.**

superMiscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  AMENDED 10-24-2022:  Court ordered financial obligations amended to include attorney fees.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment to best of ability.

Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is in the sales or distribution of alcohol. Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. Firearm warning given. Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

8:39 AM Defendant Wayne A Barbion Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher S. Hammond in court for Wayne A Barbion Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Raymond Robert Rutz III in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Deft. to plea to Ct. 1, PAC to be dismissed.  State will defer to Court if PSI would be ordered. State recommends 15 mos. IC, 15 mos. ES, standing silent on ES conditions and fine. 

PLEA: Ct. 1: G
BTC: Ct. 1: GUILTY.  Ct. 2: Dismissed.
Parties are willing to waive PSI and are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

BTC: Ct. 1: 30 mos., 15 mos. IC, 15 mos. ES.

Conditions:
Fine of $2400 plus costs and surcharges.
DL revoked for 36 mos.
Absolute sobriety, no alcohol or controlled substances.
Random UA's and breathalyzers.
AODA assessment.
Do not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is in the sales or distribution of alcohol.
Maintain employment to best of ability.
Pay costs of supervision, court costs, surcharges.
DNA sample.
36 days CFTS.

FAW/VOTE.

Not eligible for CIP.
Eligible for SAP after serving 12 months of initial confinement.

11:11 AM Defendant Wayne A Barbion Jr in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher S. Hammond in court for Wayne A Barbion Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defense states plea forms have been completed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: ***ALSO $5,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND*** Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Do not drive at all.
